result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven R. Scholze was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available 

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with B.F or her daughter.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Defendant shall be subject to random testing upon demand.

Comply with all recommendations for treatment and/or counseling of agent.

timeConds.notes: Sentence to start immediately.  EMP not ordered.  Credit for 8 days served

records.addlTxt:
Special Prosecutor Mark Radcliffe appears for the State.  Defendant appears in custody in person with counsel Matt Prior.  14TR1542 - Garret Nix appears for Village of Merrillan and states he received a letter from attorney James Ritland that he is not representing the defendant any longer on this case.  Defendant states he received a letter from attorney Ritland.  He believed he was still being represented by attorney Ritland on that case.  Court reads Motion to Dismiss filed by attorney Ritland in June.  Attorney Nix requests the court trial is to remain on the calendar in August.  Court instructs defendant to contact Attorney Ritland as there has not been a Motion to Withdraw filed.  Court calendar will remain on the Court's calendar.

14CF43 - Counsel are ready to proceed.  MR notes an error on page 4 - references wrong county.  Attorney Matt Prior states he hadn't received the revocation summary but is aware of why is is being revoked.  Prior notes 14CF228 should be 14CF43 on page 2 regarding sentence credit.  It's an error he was given 8 days credit.  State agrees with that.  State recommends a sentence of 12 mos on Count 1 and 6 months on Count 3,concurrent to Count 1, costs..  Defense states he's still on probation for 3 other cases and he has 219 days credit; requesting time served.  Defendant exercises his right to allocution.  Court orders:  Count 1 - 12 months jail; Count 3 - 6 months jail concurrent to Count 1; credit for 219 days served.  All costs, fees, and surcharges are coverted to civil judgment.
from defendant.  I advised ADA Inlow of defendant's location.  JMM
from Attorney Ritland
sent ROAW and attached summary to Judge electronically.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
with attached revocation summary.
from DOC

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Ritland.  The parties have reviewed the PSI and are prepared to proceed.  No changes noted by either party.  Court noted case number errors.  Victim notification complied with.  Attorney Fox recommends probation.  Attorney Ritland advised the court that the defendant does not want probation.  Alternatively, Attorney Fox recommends 1 year jail.  Attorney Ritland now says the defendant will accept probation.  Court questions defendant on whether he is willing to accept probation.  Defendant will accept probation.  Attorney Fox recommends 3 years probation on count 1.  Concurrent, 1 year on count 3.  60-90 days jail.  Attorney Ritland recommends probation.  No jail, or may serve on EMP.  Defendant exercised is right to allocution.  Court ordered sentence withheld, 3 years probation on count 1, 1 year on count 3 concurrent with count 1.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC +  DNA sample and surcharge.     Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.   Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located. Subject to random testing upon demand.  No contact with BF or her daughter.  30 days jail.  Comply with all recommendations for treatment and/or counseling of agent.  Maintain employment.  Credit for 8 days.  EMP not ordered.  Start jail immediately.
sent copy of PSI to Judge, DA & defense.
Sentencing hearing at 07-20-2015 10:30 am

Defendant appears with counsel James Ritland.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  The active warrant on this case was addressed in court after defendant had hearing on 15CF22.  Court states the PSI is due on this case by June 5 but the DOC agent hasn't been able to interview defendant and he has missed 2 appointments.  Probation agent Kris Gacek was present in Court.  She states she needs 1 month to complete interview and get report filed with the Court.  DA Fox recommends the defendant be remanded to jail until the interview is completed.  Court orders defendant remanded into custody until DOC is able to complete their interview for the PSI.  The interview should be completed as soon as possible and then the agent is to notify the jail he can be released after it's completed.  Court ordered the PSI due by July 13, 2015 with sentencing set for July 20, 2015 at 10:30.  The PSI due date is OK with DOC Agent Gacek.  DA Fox stated on the record that the defendant will get jail credit for the time he is in custody.  Judge agreed.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared through his Attorney, James Ritland.  PSI writer wrote the court.  Unable to complete the PSI as ordered.  Defendant is not cooperating.  Attorney Ritland said that defendant had called agent and left messages.  DA Fox requested a warrant.  Court authorized a warrant.  Defendant to be held until agent is satisfied the PSI can be completed.
from DOC.  Defendant has not cooperated with PSI process.  PSI will not be done by 6/5.
Sentencing hearing at 06-15-2015 10:30 am
Final pre-trial at 05-04-2015 03:00 pm

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Ritland.  Plea was started.  Defendant and Attorney Ritland took a break to discuss defendant's  understanding of the penalties.  Plea resumed.  Court confirmed that the defendant wished to proceed today, and that he understood the penalties in the charges he was pleading to.  Defendant said he understood and was prepared to proceed today.  Defendant plead guilty to counts 1 and 3.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant stated that he understood.  Court found defendant guilty of counts 1 and 3.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Attorney Ritland requested a PSI.   PSI ordered.  Due 6/5/15.  SEH set for 6/15/15 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-13-2015 10:30 am
ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Ritland.  This case is to be scheduled for plea/sentencing.
